caption:
Speaker Mike Johnson has only nine working days left for lawmakers to figure out government funding before the shutdown deadline — and he’ll almost certainly need House Dems’ support to pass it.

Congress will likely pass a stopgap government funding measure before Dec. 20 to fund the government until March 2025 at its current levels. But given Johnson’s razor-thin margin – plus conservatives in his conference who tend to oppose short-term funding fixes– House Dems will likely be the ones to get it over the finish line.

Typically, punting a funding deadline into a new year when Republicans will control every lever of power would make Dems shudder. This time, they’re not putting up much of a fight, but they have made one main demand clear for the stopgap: a robust supplemental package for disaster aid. More on how those negotiations could unfold at the link in bio. 

📷 Francis Chung/POLITICO
